intro: Siphonanthus glaber var. vaga, commonly known as the slender siphonanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces slender, elongated seed pods. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
